ai.summary: A scenic 11.1 km circuit that weaves through Godlingston Heath near Studland, offering open heathland, shaded woodland, and coastal views. The hike is rated moderate, with varied surfaces and gentle elevation changes, suitable for hikers with reasonable fitness and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of grassy heathland tracks, compacted dirt paths, sandier sections, and occasional boardwalks. Surfaces can be uneven and slippery after rain; some exposed stretches may be windy along the coast. Wildlife and seasonal ticks are present; wear sturdy footwear and regularly check clothing.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times if your route nears the Studland coastline. Stay on marked paths and be mindful of weather changes in coastal England. Bring a map or GPS, sufficient water, snacks, sun protection, a basic first aid kit, and a means of communication. Mobile signal can be patchy in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Sunscreen and spare clothing for emergencies
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder weather and better wildlife viewing; the route can be walked in winter with proper clothing and precautions.

seo.title: Godlingston Heath Walk, Studland – 11.1 km Moderate Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover a scenic 11.1 km moderate hike through Godlingston Heath, Studland. Enjoy heathland, woodland, and coastal views in the UK.
